Posts.Content: Sep 5, 2008 05:45PM lizlane wrote: I took Prevacid and it cut out a lot of my internal combustion problems I had with Taxol... if you do take pain relievers for the aches and pains, make sure you also have some Senecot on hand!
Posts.Title: Taxol - stomach problems? 4thefather lizlane

Posts.Content: Sep 5, 2008 04:50PM lizlane wrote: bluejay, My last taxol was april 1st and I am still not back to 100%.  I was at about 75-80% by the 1st of may and i'm probably at 95% now in terms of energy and strength... but there are lingering side effects for me, my onc had me on "dose dense" treatments... plus the chemo treatments kicked me into early menopause...  maybe by october, I will be back to "normal".  Just hang in there.. it does get better one day at a time. LL
Posts.Title: How long did it take for you to recover after chemo? bluejay1 FloridaLady

Posts.Content: Sep 6, 2008 09:35AM lizlane wrote: For my first AC infusion, I was okay until the next day, just tired, then it "hit" me... each tx after that, it took less time for it to effect me.. I think a lot of it has to do with which chemo you are getting and how often.  I didn't have much time in between to recover.  I would encourage you to have someone with you if at all possible... just having someone there is comforting.  I hope it goes well with you...
